alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluffton, Ridgeland, Jasper, Hardeeville, Sun City, Switzerland, Pritchardville, Rose Hill, Calawassie Island, Grahamville, Old House, Okatie, Coastal Carolina Hospital, Chelsea, Mitchellville, Morgan, Boyd, Deerfield, Nevadum and Levy.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
